app.extensions package

Submodules

app.extensions.log_extension module

This module contains asynchronous functions that handle post-processing actions for various entities, including user registrations, updates, and logins; collection and datafile operations; comment management; download tracking; and favorite interactions. Each function logs specific actions performed on these entities, capturing details about the request, current user, and the entity involved. The log entries are inserted into the database for audit purposes, and the functions return the processed entity or list of entities.

class app.extensions.log_extension.Log(current_user, request, entity, log_action)[source]

Bases: Base

Represents a log entry capturing details of operations on the application entities, including the request method, URL, request parameters, and the action performed on the entity. The log records the user who initiated the request and the state of the entity at the time of the operation.

created_date
entity_dict
entity_id
entity_tablename
id
log_action
request_method
request_params
request_url
user_id
class app.extensions.log_extension.LogAction(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enumeration for CRUD operations representing actions on entities: insert for adding new entities, select for retrieving entities, update for modifying existing entities, and delete for removing entities.

delete = 'delete'
insert = 'insert'
select = 'select'
update = 'update'
class app.extensions.log_extension.RequestMethod(value)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enumeration for standard HTTP request methods: GET for retrieving data, POST for submitting data, PUT for updating or creating resources, and DELETE for removing resources.

DELETE = 'DELETE'
GET = 'GET'
POST = 'POST'
PUT = 'PUT'
async app.extensions.log_extension.after__insert(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, datafile: Datafile) → Datafile[source]

Logs a datafile upload event, capturing details about the datafile and the request. Returns the uploaded datafile.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_collection_delete(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, collection: Collection) → Collection[source]

Logs a collection deletion event, capturing details about the collection and the request. Returns the deleted collection.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_collection_insert(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, collection: Collection) → Collection[source]

Logs a collection insertion event, capturing details about the collection and the request. Returns the newly inserted collection.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_collection_list(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, collections: List[Collection]) → List[Collection][source]

Logs a collections list retrieval event for each collection in the list, capturing details about each collection and the request. Returns the list of collections.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_collection_select(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, collection: Collection) → Collection[source]

Logs a collection selection event, capturing details about the collection and the request. Returns the selected collection.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_collection_update(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, collection: Collection) → Collection[source]

Logs a collection update event, capturing details about the collection and the request. Returns the updated collection.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_comment_delete(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, comment: Comment) → Comment[source]

Logs a comment deletion event, capturing details about the deleted comment and the request. Returns the deleted comment.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_comment_insert(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, comment: Comment) → Comment[source]

Logs a comment insertion event, capturing details about the comment and the request. Returns the inserted comment.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_comment_list(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, comments: List[Comment]) → List[Comment][source]

Logs the retrieval of a list of comments, capturing details about each comment and the request. Returns the list of comments.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_comment_select(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, comment: Comment) → Comment[source]

Logs a comment retrieval event, capturing details about the comment and the request. Returns the selected comment.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_comment_update(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, comment: Comment) → Comment[source]

Logs a comment update event, capturing details about the updated comment and the request. Returns the updated comment.

Logs a datafile selection event, capturing details about the datafile and the request. Returns the selected datafile.

Logs the retrieval of a list of downloads, capturing details about each download and the request. Returns the list of downloads.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_favorite_select(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, favorite: Favorite) → Favorite[source]

Logs a password update event, capturing details about the user and the request. Returns the user whose password was updated.

async app.extensions.log_extension.after_token_invalidate(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, request: Request, current_user: User, user: User) → User[source]

Logs a token invalidation event, capturing details about the user and the request. Returns the user associated with the invalidated token.

Logs a token retrieval event, capturing details about the user and the request. Returns the user associated with the token.

Logs a user registration event, capturing details about the new user and the request. Returns the registered user.

app.extensions.sample_extension module

Sample extension module for handling event hook functions triggered by corresponding events within the application. Each function is associated with a specific event and is designed to be executed when that event occurs. Functions may include additional logic such as event logging, updating the database, managing the cache, performing file or network operations, interacting with third-party applications, and other related actions.

async app.extensions.sample_extension.after_collection_delete(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, current_user: User, collection: Collection)[source]

Executes after a collection is deleted. Receives the collection entity and performs any necessary post-processing actions.

async app.extensions.sample_extension.after_collection_insert(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, current_user: User, collection: Collection)[source]

Executes after a collection is created. Receives the collection entity and performs any necessary post-processing actions.

async app.extensions.sample_extension.after_collection_list(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, current_user: User, collections: List[Collection])[source]

Executes after a collection list is retrieved. Receives the list of collection entities and performs any necessary post-processing actions.

async app.extensions.sample_extension.after_collection_select(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, current_user: User, collection: Collection)[source]

Executes after a collection is selected. Receives the collection entity and performs any necessary post-processing actions.

async app.extensions.sample_extension.after_collection_update(entity_manager: EntityManager, cache_manager: CacheManager, current_user: User, collection: Collection)[source]

Executes after a collection is updated. Receives the collection entity and performs any necessary post-processing actions.
